attributes.action: UK must work to end war in Syria by diplomacy and aid; NOT intervene militarily.
attributes.additional_details: Chris Doyle is the director of the Council for Arab-British Understanding. His article that details graphically the "war economy" of the region can be found here. http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/syria-conflict-we-must-stop-the-country-s-economy-being-dependent-on-war-a6707651.html
attributes.background: There is nothing to suggest military intervention will help. Obama links the rise of Isis to the US invasion of Iraq. Mr Cameron recognises aid is needed to help war-torn countries. Chris Doyle - “Syrians want to see one major international actor trying to end this awful war, not join it.”
